p.s: I am writing this letter to you because about thirty years ago I read your speec at the World Leaders Summit Opening Ceremony about the climate crisis in class.
At that time I was very impressed about your optimism.
But you also thought about the future and the next generations.
You were afraid of failing because of the anger of unborn humans.
You did not forget them and were sure that you had the neccesary possibilityspossibilities.
Now, I am mother of two children, but they are not kids anymore.
One of them is not living with me anymore, but the other one still goes to school.
When they were born there was chaos in the world.
Everyone was afraid of war because of the political situation and climate change was still a huge problem.
Now I can say that the aims of the COP26 are not reality yet, but can be very soon.
So I thank you for your hope you gave my generation with your speech.
We have no long-term solution, as you predicted, but there are on-going agreements.
The raising temperature has been controlled in some ways.
But I do not konw how the future of my kids is going to be.
But your speech always gives me hope, that we can find the wire and stop the destroying device.
You were a bit totoo optimistic!
